A classic work from a giant among mid-twentieth century German scholars. The extended subtitle is revealing of the massive scope and primary focus of this introduction. For many years this was the standard critical introduction to the field and it still retains great usefulness

note: An innovative and intriguing approach.
title: An Introduction to the Hebrew Bible: A Thematic Approach

For many years a standard introduction, Gottwald’s volume—also available in an abbreviated form (The Hebrew Bible: A Brief Socio-Literary Introduction
2008)—is still unique in its heavy attention to sociopolitical matters

The Meaning of the Bible: What the Jewish Scriptures and Christian Old Testament Can Teach Us
